body_html:
I just followed your response which indicated contributions welcome.

Does "large" means, it can take several weeks or does "retired" means I should close this PR right now? I am ok with both as long as it is clearly communicated and this PR does not disappear in the flood of PRs of small fixes without any decision.

For the definition of significance: almost all recent state-of-the-art optical-flow estimation approaches rely on this operation, and there is no way to code this as a one-liner python code.

I can attest that it is not completely trivial to have C++ ops in an external project at this point.

That's not true. I did multiple times here and here. I am happy to keep it there. Without wanting to sound rude, I guess there might be some broader interest making it acceptable to ship such an operation directly by TensorFlow.

I will certainly not rebase again the master HEAD after a month or so. So we should let this PR die right now, if there is no interest.

body:
I just followed your response which indicated [contributions welcome](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/11956#issuecomment-362761880).

Does "large" means, it can take several weeks or does "retired" means I should close this PR right now? I am ok with both as long as it is clearly communicated and this PR does not disappear in the flood of PRs of small fixes without any decision.

For the definition of significance: almost all recent state-of-the-art optical-flow estimation approaches rely on this operation, and there is no way to code this as a one-liner python code.

>  I can attest that it is not completely trivial to have C++ ops in an external project at this point.

That's not true. I did multiple times [here](https://github.com/PatWie/tensorflow-cmake) and [here](https://github.com/PatWie/tensorflow-recipes/tree/master/OpticalFlow). I am happy to keep it there. Without wanting to sound rude, I guess there might be some broader interest making it acceptable to ship such an operation directly by TensorFlow.

I will certainly not rebase again the master HEAD after a month or so. So we should let this PR die right now, if there is no interest.
